com.ibm.cloud.objectstorage.config.resource_configuration.v1.model

Class Firewall

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.cloud.sdk.core.service.model.GenericModel
      • com.ibm.cloud.objectstorage.config.resource_configuration.v1.model.Firewall
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.ibm.cloud.sdk.core.service.model.ObjectModel

    public class Firewall
extends com.ibm.cloud.sdk.core.service.model.GenericModel
    An access control mechanism based on the network (IP address) where request originated. Requests not originating from IP addresses listed in the `allowed_ip` field will be denied regardless of any access policies (including public access) that might otherwise permit the request. Viewing or updating the `Firewall` element requires the requester to have the `manager` role.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllowedIp

        public List<String> getAllowedIp()
        Gets the allowedIp. List of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses in CIDR notation to be affected by firewall in CIDR notation is supported. Passing an empty array will lift the IP address filter. The `allowed_ip` array can contain a maximum of 1000 items.
        Returns:
        the allowedIp

      • getDeniedIp

        public List<String> getDeniedIp()
        Gets the deniedIp. List of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses in CIDR notation to be affected by firewall in CIDR notation is supported. Passing an empty array will lift the IP address filter. The `denied_ip` array can contain a maximum of 1000 items.
        Returns:
        the deniedIp

      • getAllowedNetworkType

        public List<String> getAllowedNetworkType()
        Gets the allowedNetworkType. Indicates which network types are allowed for bucket access. May contain `public`, `private`, and/or `direct` elements. Setting `allowed_network_type` to only `private` will prevent access to object storage from outside of the IBM Cloud. The entire array will be overwritten in a `PATCH` operation. For more information on network types, [see the documentation](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/cloud-object-storage?topic=cloud-object-storage-endpoints#advanced-endpoint-types).
        Returns:
        the allowedNetworkType
